title: Man appears in court charged with murder of his wife
text:
News Man appears in court charged with murder of his wife James Neary is charged with the murder of Christine Neary, also known as Chrissie Kendall, 46, between January 27 and January 29. Share Get daily   Could   
A man has appeared in court charged with the murder of his wife. 
James Neary, 46, of Kinver Road in Moston , Manchester, spoke only to confirm his name, date of birth and address during a brief hearing at Manchester Magistrates Court today. 
He stood in the dock flanked by security guards wearing a grey tracksuit as members of the family sat in the public gallery. 
Mr Neary is charged with the murder of Christine Neary, also known as Chrissie Kendall, 46, between January 27 and January 29. 
No further details were revealed in court. 
Mr Neary didn’t enter a plea. 
Magistrates were told that the case could only be dealt with at the crown court. Read More 
He is due to appear at Manchester Crown Court within 48 hours. 
There was no application for bail. 
Shocked friends and family took to Facebook to pay tribute to Christine after hearing of her tragic death. 
One wrote: “Chrissy was a lovely lady I knew her through nursery. I thought she was great and very supportive, inspiring, she often gave me advice and I has so much respect for her! Rip Chrissy and my love to your family and friends.” 
Another tribute read: “A truly beautiful mum, sister, grandma, Aunty and friend.” 
Mr Neary was remanded in custody but the court was told that he is expected to be taken directly to hospital rather than prison. 
He is due to appear at Manchester Crown Court on March 2. Like us on Facebook
